page.title: 04HUMSHAUGH TRANSPORT
page.content: THE MAIN FORM OF TRANSPORT IS THE PRIVATE {CAR;}THE RAILWAY IS EXTINCT AND THE DAILY{BUS}SERVICE TO HEXHAM AND BELLINGHAM IS INFREQUENT. THERE- FORE IN THE VILLAGE 62 ESTABLISHMENTS HAVE A CAR, SOMETIMES A SECOND VEHICLE. THE B6318 KNOWN AS GENERAL WADE'S MILITARY{ROAD,}LINKS CARLISLE AND NEWCASTLE. THE B6320 TO BELLINGHAM BY-PASSES THE VILLAGE. A GOOD NETWORK OF SMALLER ROADS SERVES OUTLYING SETTLEMENTS AND FARMS. THESE ARE MAINLY TARMACADAM AND IN A GOOD STATE OF REPAIR. GETTING TO THE MAIN ROADS CAN BE DIFFICULT IN THE SNOW IN WINTER. THE TASK OF CLEARING SMALLER ROADS IS OFTEN LEFT TO THE FARMER'S TRACTOR. PUBLIC TRANSPORT IS USED BY MOST CHILDREN OVER NINE TO ATTEND HEXHAM SCHOOLS. EARLY MORNING SEES MANY CHILDREN WAITING NEAR THE CROWN INN FOR "SCHOOL BUSES".
